title: Wield
data:
***Version [0.25](/0.25 "0.25")**: This article **may not be** up to date for the [latest stable release](/0.32 "0.32") of Crawl.*

**Wielding** is the action of holding an [item](/Item "Item") in the hand, performed with the **w** key.

While an item is wielded, it will be used by your character to perform [melee combat](/Melee_combat "Melee combat"), so the main use of wielding is to ready [weapons](/Weapon "Weapon"). [Ranged weapons](/Ranged_weapon "Ranged weapon") also require wielding before they can be used.

Wielding is also required for some [artefact staves](/Evocable_items#Artefact_staves "Evocable items") before their powers can be [evoked](/Evocation "Evocation").

The game will warn the player if they attempt to perform melee combat with an unsuitable weapon, as this is a common mistake.

## Contents

- [1 Wielding nothing](#Wielding_nothing)
- [2 Switching between weapons](#Switching_between_weapons)
- [3 Wielding failure](#Wielding_failure)
- [4 Exceptions to wielding](#Exceptions_to_wielding)
- [5 Wielding cursed weapons](#Wielding_cursed_weapons)
- [6 Wielding distortion weapons](#Wielding_distortion_weapons)
- [7 History](#History)

## Wielding nothing

The player may choose to wield nothing and go empty handed, by pressing **-** (the minus key) when prompted for an item. Characters who intend to use [Unarmed Combat](/Unarmed_Combat "Unarmed Combat") will usually wield nothing.

## Switching between weapons

Pressing ' (the apostrophe key) will attempt to wield and switch between the contents of the special inventory slots "a" and "b". The player may set their favorite weapons to these two slots by pressing the **=** key, then selecting **i**tems.

Note that you will not wield an item in one of those slots if it is unsuitable for wielding (i.e. wands, armour, etc.); instead, you will simply wield nothing. This is useful for Unarmed Combat specialists, who can keep a non-weapon item in one of their "a" or "b" slots to have a way to easily switch back to their fists.

## Wielding failure

Wielding will fail if:

- the item the player is trying to wield is too large for them
- the player is already wielding a [cursed](/Cursed "Cursed") weapon
- the player tries to wield the item they are already wielding
- the item requires two hands to wield and the player is wearing a shield

## Exceptions to wielding

There are several items that do not require wielding to use. [Wands](/Wand "Wand") can be [zapped](/Zap "Zap") and [throwing](/Throwing "Throwing") weapons can be thrown directly from the inventory, and other evocable items function this way as well. Note that some of these items require thumbs to use, so characters without thumbs (i.e. [Felids](/Felid "Felid") and those in certain form changes) still won't be able to use them.

## Wielding cursed weapons

A [cursed](/Cursed "Cursed") weapon will stick to your hand when wielded, making it impossible to unwield or [drop](/Drop "Drop").

## Wielding distortion weapons

Unwielding [distortion](/Distortion "Distortion")-branded weapons can inflict [magical contamination](/Magical_contamination "Magical contamination"), [teleport](/Teleport "Teleport") you next to a random monster on the level, or even [banish](/Banish "Banish") into the [Abyss](/Abyss "Abyss"). For this reason, low-level players should exercise caution in wielding known and possible distortion weapons. Risk-averse players can [identify](/Identify "Identify") suspect weapons before wielding. An identified distortion weapon will always ask for a confirmation before wielding.

## History

- Prior to [0.24](/0.24 "0.24"), [vampiric](/Vampiric "Vampiric") weapons required the player to be [Full](/Comestibles_and_satiation#Satiation "Comestibles and satiation") or above to equip them.
- Prior to [0.20](/0.20 "0.20"), the player had to wield [stones](/Stone "Stone") or [large rocks](/Large_rock "Large rock") to boost [Sandblast](/Sandblast "Sandblast")'s damage. Also, the player couldn't (un)wield things while [berserk](/Berserk "Berserk").
- Prior to [0.17](/0.17 "0.17"), casting [Sticks to Snakes](/Sticks_to_Snakes "Sticks to Snakes") required wielding [javelins](/Javelin "Javelin") or [arrows](/Arrow "Arrow").
- Prior to [0.12](/0.12 "0.12"), wielding a cursed, blunt weapon prevented butchering.
- Prior to [0.9](/0.9 "0.9"), the player was required to wield a sharp weapon for [butchering](/Butchering "Butchering").

Wielding is the action of holding an item in the hand, performed with the w key.

While an item is wielded, it will be used by your character to perform melee combat, so the main use of wielding is to ready weapons. Ranged weapons also require wielding before they can be used.

Wielding is also required for some artefact staves before their powers can be evoked.

The game will warn the player if they attempt to perform melee combat with an unsuitable weapon, as this is a common mistake.

  • 1 Wielding nothing
  • 2 Switching between weapons
  • 3 Wielding failure
  • 4 Exceptions to wielding
  • 5 Wielding cursed weapons
  • 6 Wielding distortion weapons
  • 7 History

Wielding nothing

The player may choose to wield nothing and go empty handed, by pressing - (the minus key) when prompted for an item. Characters who intend to use Unarmed Combat will usually wield nothing.

Switching between weapons

Pressing ' (the apostrophe key) will attempt to wield and switch between the contents of the special inventory slots "a" and "b". The player may set their favorite weapons to these two slots by pressing the = key, then selecting items.

Note that you will not wield an item in one of those slots if it is unsuitable for wielding (i.e. wands, armour, etc.); instead, you will simply wield nothing. This is useful for Unarmed Combat specialists, who can keep a non-weapon item in one of their "a" or "b" slots to have a way to easily switch back to their fists.

Wielding failure

Wielding will fail if:

  • the item the player is trying to wield is too large for them
  • the player is already wielding a cursed weapon
  • the player tries to wield the item they are already wielding
  • the item requires two hands to wield and the player is wearing a shield

Exceptions to wielding

There are several items that do not require wielding to use. Wands can be zapped and throwing weapons can be thrown directly from the inventory, and other evocable items function this way as well. Note that some of these items require thumbs to use, so characters without thumbs (i.e. Felids and those in certain form changes) still won't be able to use them.

Wielding cursed weapons

A cursed weapon will stick to your hand when wielded, making it impossible to unwield or drop.

Wielding distortion weapons

Unwielding distortion-branded weapons can inflict magical contamination, teleport you next to a random monster on the level, or even banish into the Abyss. For this reason, low-level players should exercise caution in wielding known and possible distortion weapons. Risk-averse players can identify suspect weapons before wielding. An identified distortion weapon will always ask for a confirmation before wielding.

History

  • Prior to 0.24, vampiric weapons required the player to be Full or above to equip them.
  • Prior to 0.20, the player had to wield stones or large rocks to boost Sandblast's damage. Also, the player couldn't (un)wield things while berserk.
  • Prior to 0.17, casting Sticks to Snakes required wielding javelins or arrows.
  • Prior to 0.12, wielding a cursed, blunt weapon prevented butchering.
  • Prior to 0.9, the player was required to wield a sharp weapon for butchering.
